arm_group.description: Control Group, which were subjected only to evaluations and to no exercise
Study group (SG), was oriented to perform domiciliary exercises for the upper limbs.

brief_summary.textblock:
To observe the effect of domiciliary physiotherapy on the upper limb applied during the
      period of radiotherapy in women submitted to surgical and radiotherapy for breast cancer.
      The parameters evaluated were: shoulder range of movement (ROM) and arm circumference. There
      was significant difference between the ipsilateral and contralateral limbs for flexion,
      abduction and external rotation. There was no difference in perimetry in either group

clinical_study.brief_title: Domiciliary Physiotherapy in Women Undergoing Treatment for Breast Cancer Radiation

facility.name: Hospital das Clínicas de Ribeirão Preto da Faculdade de Medicina de Ribeirão Preto da Universidade de São Paulo

clinical_study.official_title: Domiciliary Physiotherapy in Women Undergoing Treatment for Breast Cancer Radiation

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: CONEP - Comitê Nacional de Ética em Pesquisa

primary_outcome.measure: Recovery of shoulder range of movements (ROM) and prevention of arm lymphedema

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
